title: How Ryan  The Welsh Wanderer  Giggs became football biggest player : An eight - year affair with his brother wife , THAT gagging order , Hall Of Fame snub and arrest
body_text:
How Ryan 'The Welsh Wanderer' Giggs became football's biggest player: An eight-year affair with his brother's wife, THAT gagging order, Hall Of Fame snub and arrest
- Have YOU got a story? Email tips@dailymail.com
Ryan Giggs' sporting career earned him the accolades of the best winger in the history of football and one of the best players of his time.
Yet the star's playing was not limited to the field, as during nearly four decades in the spotlight his name has become as synonymous with scandal than it has with football.
The ace, 51, earned the nickname 'The Welsh Wanderer' through his shocking antics including an eight-year affair with his brother's wife, a gagging order and a dramatic arrest for assault and domestic abuse.
Scandal has had an impact on the later stages of Ryan's career as earlier this year he was snubbed by the Premier League's Hall of Fame.
This shock came despite him winning a whopping 13 titles during his 24-year spell at Man United and 64 caps for Wales.
Daily Mail takes a look at how Ryan became one of football's biggest players...

In 2010 he also embarked on a steamy seven month fling with Big Brother contestant Imogen Thomas (pictured)
Daily Mail takes a look at how Ryan (pictured 2001) became one of football's biggest players
HE AIN'T HEAVY, HE'S MY BROTHER
In 2011 it came to light that Ryan had been having an affair with his brother Rhodri's wife Natasha whilst he was married to wife of four-years Stacey Cooke, with whom he shares son Zach, 17, and daughter Libby, 19.
Natasha, who has two sons with Rhodri, even fell pregnant by Ryan and aborting his child just two weeks before her wedding to his brother in Las Vegas.
The pair first met in a nightclub in Manchester in March 2003 and Natasha spent the night with him while his then pregnant fiancée Stacey was at home.
Despite the fact that Natasha started dating Rhodri just two months later, the pair resumed their affair after a year, conducting illicit liaisons in hotel rooms and vacant properties she had access to through her job as an estate agent.
Rhodri also said he discovered many of his footballer friends were 'at it' with his ex and even claimed one them fled a bar in Portugal instead of facing him.
Members of Ryan's family cut ties with him when the news broke, his dad saying he was 'ashamed' of his son, while Natasha cashed in on the scandal and appeared a year later on Celebrity Big Brother.
Discussing the he pair's first confrontation in 2011, Rhodri previously admitted that he'll still be there for his brother if he ever wants to reach out.

Rhodri said: 'Eventually he got the courage to meet me three or four weeks after. It was at a friend's house, he said it was about sex, it wasn't this, feeling sorry for himself basically and telling me how his contract was cr*p with Reebok,'
'It was the s******t contract in the world, bearing in mind he's getting paid a lot just to wear trainers and that's the s******t contract. Well you f***ing signed it you d***.
'It was all like I'm going to get stick, get the f***ing violin out. That's him. I felt sorry for him, all the stuff that you've done and you're going on like some b****, just f***ing get away from me.
'He can ring me whenever he wants. I've moved on, I've got a new career working in schools. All the s*** that I've gone through in life, I've dealt with it on my own mostly.'
Giggs' marriage to Stacey survived the affair, before eventually splitting in 2017 after ten years together.
THE GAGGING ORDER
Despite having an affair with Natasha and still being married to Stacey, Ryan still wanted more and so in 2010 embarked on a steamy seven month fling with Big Brother contestant Imogen Thomas.
‘We hit it off straight away because we had so much in common,’ gushed Imogen in a breathless interview with a Sunday tabloid at the time which she made under the condition she would not name the footballer.
This was due to a gagging order that Giggs had made to stop details of their seven-month liaison becoming public at a time when his love life was under more scrutiny than ever.
Despite the footballer's expensive £150,000 super injunction, details of the steamy affair eventually came out when Lib Dem MP John Hemming used Parliamentary privilege to name him in the House of Commons.
Giggs is alleged to have recognised Thomas in a night club before pursuing her, and was keen to keep their relationship under wraps due to her history.
She had posed topless for lads’ magazines, and had already dated Tottenham striker Jermain Defoe and Russell Brand.
According to the footballer’s statement released after the scandal broke he and Thomas ‘met four times between September and December in 2010’.
Despite having an affair with Natasha and still being married to Stacey, in 2010 Ryan embarked on a steamy seven month fling with Big Brother contestant Imogen Thomas (pictured)

She allegedly told him ‘she wanted’, or ‘needed’, a payment from him of £50,000.
She then contacted him by text in March 2011, which led him to conclude she was thinking of selling her story.
She allegedly told him ‘she wanted’, or ‘needed’, a payment from him of £50,000. Giggs agreed to meet her in a hotel where he was staying.
There, he claimed he gave her a signed football shirt, but said he was not prepared to give her £50,000. She asked to see him again shortly afterwards, to which ‘he agreed with reluctance’ and provided her with some football tickets.
Although the position was ‘by no means clear’, the judge initially said the evidence ‘appeared to suggest’ Thomas had arranged the two hotel meetings ‘in collaboration with photographers and/or journalists’.
However, Giggseventually withdrew any legal action and a statement read out to the court by Thomas’s lawyer confirmed that the parties had resolved matter between them, and Ryan accepted there was no basis to accuse her of blackmail.
Thomas eventually sold her story through Max Clifford. Her ‘edited’ version appeared in the Sunday Mirror.
‘He’s not like other footballers,’ she said in the interview. ‘He seemed very decent and private with good morals, and I fell for that.’
ARREST
Giggs was then appointed as Wales boss in 2018 but his career was thrown into chaos in November 2020 after being arrested on suspicion of two counts of assault against his ex-girlfriend, Kate Greville, and her younger sister, Emma.
He always denied the charges.
The winger was cleared of assaulting Greville, who declined to co-operate with a retrial, in 2023. Ryan was also cleared on further counts of coercive or controlling behaviour against her and common assault against Emma.
Chris Daw KC, defending Giggs, said in court that his client was 'deeply relieved the prosecution has finally come to an end after almost three years in which he's been fighting throughout to clear his name', adding: 'He has always been innocent of these charges - there's been very, very many lies told about him in court.'
Ryan was then appointed as Wales boss in 2018 but his career was thrown into chaos in November 2020 after being arrested on suspicion of two counts of assault against his ex-girlfriend, Kate Greville, and her younger sister, Emma
Giggs had pleaded not guilty to controlling or coercive behaviour over a three-year period before being cleared of assaulting Greville (pictured) who declined to co-operate with a retrial
It is revealed how the case began to fall apart in when Greville said she did not want to testify due to the effects of the process on her 'mental and physical well-being.'
However lawyers for Giggs said he 'did not buy' her reasoning, insisting the prosecution was put off by new information uncovered by the defence, including a cosmetic procedure to have lip fillers on or around the day of the alleged attack - several days before she was pictured with apparently swollen and bruised lips as a result of the alleged attack.
Giggs' barrister said his client was 'looking forward to rebuilding his life and career as an innocent man'.
During the initial 2022 trial Greville was accused of planning to 'get pregnant' by Giggs, after lawyers highlighted a message she sent a friend in October 2020 – just weeks before the alleged assault – that she was 'not walking away with nothing'.
It came after she told friends she was 'planning my attack' after learning the footballer had been cheating on her with eight other women.
'Your plan was to get pregnant by Mr Giggs,' he asked her.
Greville replied 'absolutely not', saying she had meant she didn't want to walk away without their golden retriever puppy, Mac.
The footballer's lawyer read out a message in which she asked Giggs about buying a £1,000 pair of Prada boots from Harrods.
He asked whether she had 'got very used to the lifestyle you enjoyed with Mr Giggs'.
But Greville responded that she could 'still provide for myself' as a single woman even though she would not be entitled to any financial support as they weren't married.
Hall of Fame snub
Earlier this year Giggs broke his silence on being snubbed by the Premier League's Hall of Fame.
He is the top flight's most decorated footballer having won 13 titles during his 24-year spell in Manchester United's first team. As well as winning 64 caps for Wales and played for Team GB at the London 2012 Olympics, earning legendary status at United and subsequently spent three years coaching at the club.
However amid his numerous scandals his name has been conspicuously absent from the Premier League's Hall of Fame, which was launched in 2020 before its first inductions took place in 2021.
It aims to recognise and honour players and managers that have achieved great success and made a significant contribution to the Premier League, with 22 players and two managers inducted so far.
Earlier this year Giggs broke his silence on being snubbed by the Premier League 's Hall of Fame
Despite being the Premier League's most decorated player, he is not among the inductees
Giggs, speaking to former team-mate Rio Ferdinand, said the snub didn't really bother him
The footballer is now in a relationship with 36-year-old Zara Charles with whom he welcomed daughter Cora in November 2025
And, speaking on Rio Ferdinand Presents to his former United colleague, Giggs was pressed on whether the snub is something that plays on his mind.
'Not really,' Giggs said. 'No, I mean, I don't think about it until you just brought it up. I don't think about it.
'I think when you start off, you don't... These are the things that you're not striving for. You're striving off to win games and try and win trophies. That's the most important thing for me.'
Giggs asked Ferdinand whether he had made the list, with the former defender explaining how he was inducted in 2023.
'Now I am upset,' Giggs joked. 'Now I am... Jeez, what's going on? I'm going to look at the list now when I go home.'
He then aimed a cheeky dig at another former United defender in Gary Neville as he added: 'Is Nev on it?'
Ferdinand then replied: 'No, I don't think Nev's on it yet. He'll get on it soon. He'll talk his way into it, won't he?'
